availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p:
Casey County, Kentucky, soldier. Boyle County, Kentucky native. Married to Rebecca Anne Rains. Father of Francis, Eleanor, Eliza, James, Chinesa, Martha, and Sarah Rains.
Farmer in Casey County, Kentucky in 1860. Served as captain in the First Regiment Kentucky Cavalry from October 6, 1861 to May 1862. Served as second lieutenant in the Casey County State Guards from February to October 1865.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 821.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Casey, District 5, p. 454.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle, Precinct 3, p. 195A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 10.
Find A Grave, "Cpt William Rains (1825-1899)," Memorial #112961664. http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/112961664 (accessed September 5, 2019).
